cards.name: Venonat
cards.text: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Venomoth
cards.text: The scales it scatters will paralyze anyone who touches them, making that person unable to stand.

attacks.name: Dizzying Wind
attacks.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Trainer card from his or her hand during his or her next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that card has no effect. (Your opponent still discards that card.)

attacks.name: Noxious Scales
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Yanma
cards.text: Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its head. It won't miss prey—even those behind it.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Yanmega
cards.text: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes' heads instantly while flying by at high speed.

attacks.name: Windfall
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

attacks.name: Surprise Strike
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Sewaddle
cards.text: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Swadloon
cards.text: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

attacks.name: Protect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Leavanny
cards.text: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.

attacks.name: Coordinate
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon that have no Pokémon Tools attached to them. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card, and attach it to that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Leaf Storm
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Grass Pokémon.

cards.name: Karrablast
cards.text: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.

cards.name: Fletchinder
cards.text: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.

cards.name: Talonflame
cards.text: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Jet Shoot
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is increased by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Litleo
cards.text: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Pyroar

abilities.name: Flare Command
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

cards.text: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.

attacks.name: Inferno Onrush
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Krabby
cards.text: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

cards.name: Kingler
cards.text: The large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Totodile
cards.text: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.

attacks.name: Fury Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Croconaw
cards.text: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Feraligatr
cards.text: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.

attacks.name: Hyper Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Finneon
cards.text: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.

cards.name: Lumineon
cards.text: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.

attacks.name: Neon Sign
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Frillish
cards.text: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Jellicent
cards.text: Its body is mostly seawater. It's said there's a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.

attacks.name: Meddling
attacks.text: Attach 3 Energy cards from your opponent's discard pile to his or her Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Ensnaring Spray
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Alomomola
cards.text: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.

attacks.name: Super Deep Dive
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Manectric-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Assault Laser
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: M Manectric-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Turbo Bolt
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: M Manectric-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Turbo Bolt
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Pachirisu
cards.text: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

attacks.name: Trick Sticker
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon's Weakness is now Lightning until the end of your next turn. (The amount of Weakness doesn't change.)

attacks.name: Pachi
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Joltik
cards.text: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.

attacks.name: Night March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Pokémon in your discard pile that have the Night March attack.

cards.name: Galvantula
cards.text: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.

attacks.name: Cobweb Trip
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with your opponent's Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Electroweb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Helioptile
cards.text: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Helioptile
cards.text: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Heliolisk
cards.text: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

attacks.name: Parabolic Spark
attacks.text: Discard as many Lightning Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

cards.name: Zubat
cards.text: Even though it has no eyes, it can sense obstacles using ultrasonic waves it emits from it mouth.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Golbat

abilities.name: Sneaky Bite
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: Once it bites, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

attacks.name: Swoop Across
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Crobat

abilities.name: Surprise Bite
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: It flies so silently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Gengar-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Night Attack
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Corridor
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: M Gengar-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Phantom Gate
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

cards.name: Wobbuffet

abilities.name: Bide Barricade
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, each Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities (except for Psychic Pokémon).

cards.text: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to build up its counterstrike.

attacks.name: Psychic Assault
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Gulpin
cards.text: It has a small heart and brain. Its stomach compromises most of its body, with enzymes to dissolve anything.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Swalot
cards.text: It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids from its follicles to douse foes.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: If, before doing damage, your opponent's Active Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than this Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Munna
cards.text: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.

attacks.name: See Through
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Musharna
cards.text: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dream of Memories
attacks.text: Shuffle 3 cards from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Dream Dance
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Asleep.

cards.name: Litwick
cards.text: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Lampent
cards.text: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Night March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Pokémon in your discard pile that have the Night March attack.

cards.name: Chandelure

abilities.name: Fainting Spell
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, the Attacking Pokémon is Knocked Out.

cards.text: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 6 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Pumpkaboo
cards.text: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

attacks.name: Night March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Pokémon in your discard pile that have the Night March attack.

cards.name: Gourgeist

abilities.name: Gourgantic
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Grass Energy attached to it, its maximum HP is 200.

cards.text: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.

attacks.name: Horror Note
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Gligar
cards.text: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.

attacks.name: Rock Cannon
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Gliscor
cards.text: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

attacks.name: Submission Hold
attacks.text: Your opponent can't attach Energy from his or her hand to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Roggenrola
cards.text: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.

cards.name: Boldore
cards.text: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.

attacks.name: Core Heal
attacks.text: Discard a Fighting Energy attached to this Pokémon and heal 50 damage from it.

cards.name: Gigalith

abilities.name: High Density Armor
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP, any damage done to this Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 50 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.

attacks.name: Overdrive Smash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Overdrive Smash attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Murkrow
cards.text: It hides any shiny object it finds in a secret location. Murkrow and Meowth loot one another's stashes.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Honchkrow
cards.text: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called "Summoner of Night."

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Nightmare Mambo
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Poochyena
cards.text: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Mightyena
cards.text: It will always obey the commands of a skilled Trainer. Its behavior arises from its living in packs in ancient times.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Spiritomb
cards.text: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.

attacks.name: B Cancel
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon from his or her hand to evolve the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Purrloin
cards.text: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Liepard
cards.text: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.

attacks.name: Gentle Bite
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 60 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Mach Claw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Malamar-EX

abilities.name: Hyper Hypnosis
abilities.text: When you attach an Energy from your hand to this Pokémon, you may use this Ability. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: MAXamar
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Skarmory
cards.text: After nesting in bramble bushes, the wings of its chicks grow hard from scratches by thorns.

attacks.name: Iron Wing
attacks.text: Discard a Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Bronzor
cards.text: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.

cards.name: Bronzong

abilities.name: Metal Links
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.

cards.name: Dialga-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Chrono Wind
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Full Metal Impact
attacks.text: Discard 2 Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Heatran
cards.text: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

attacks.name: Steel Drop
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Steam Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Escavalier
cards.text: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.

attacks.name: Poke Through
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Spiral Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Aegislash-EX

abilities.name: Mighty Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Special Energy attached to it.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Slash Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Aegislash-EX

abilities.name: Mighty Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from each of your opponent's Pokémon that has Special Energy attached to it.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Slash Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Klefki
cards.text: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dull Light
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Florges-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Bright Garden
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Grass Pokémon and Fairy Pokémon you have in play.

cards.name: Swirlix
cards.text: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and as sticky as cotton candy.

attacks.name: Lick Away
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Slurpuff

abilities.name: Tasting
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, draw 1 more card.

cards.text: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.

attacks.name: Light Pulse
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Dedenne
cards.text: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Diancie
cards.text: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

attacks.name: Sparkle
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Diamond Storm
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Fairy Pokémon.

cards.name: Deino
cards.text: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.

attacks.name: Gnaw Off
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Zweilous
cards.text: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Hydreigon

abilities.name: Dark Impulse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Their heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.

attacks.name: Crazy Headbutt
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Goomy
cards.text: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn't dry out.

attacks.name: Gooey
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon

cards.name: Sliggoo
cards.text: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can't see anything.

attacks.name: Gooey
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Goodra

abilities.name: Slip Trip
abilities.text: Each player can't attach any Pokémon Tool cards from his or her hand to any of his or her Pokémon.

cards.text: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck.

cards.name: Spearow
cards.text: Very protective of its territory, it flaps its short wings busily to dart around at high speed.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Fearow
cards.text: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land or rest.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Chansey
cards.text: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its egg with injured people.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lucky Punch
attacks.text: If you don't have exactly 7 cards in your hand, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Blissey
cards.text: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.

attacks.name: Tender Vengeance
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Charge Dash
attacks.text: You may do 20 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Girafarig
cards.text: While it sleeps, the head of its tail keeps watch. The tail doesn't need to sleep.

attacks.name: Psybite
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Psychic Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Whismur
cards.text: It usually murmurs but starts crying loudly if it senses danger. It stops when its ear covers are shut.

attacks.name: Screaming Fit
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

cards.name: Loudred
cards.text: It shouts loudly by inhaling air, and then using its well-developed stomach muscles to exhale.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Exploud
cards.text: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.

attacks.name: Boomburst
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Regigigas
cards.text: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.

attacks.name: Daunt
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 40 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Bunnelby
cards.text: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.

cards.name: Diggersby
cards.text: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.

attacks.name: Smithereen Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Fletchling
cards.text: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Furfrou
cards.text: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: AZ
cards.text: Put 1 Pokémon into your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that Pokémon.),You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Battle Compressor Team Flare Gear
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and discard them. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Dimension Valley
cards.text: Each Psychic Pokémon's attacks (both yours and your opponent's) cost Colorless less.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Enhanced Hammer
cards.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Gengar Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Gengar-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Hand Scope
cards.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Head Ringer Team Flare Hyper Gear
cards.text: Attach this Pokemon Tool to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon-EX that doesn't already have a Pokemon Tool attached to it.,The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to cost Colorless more.,When this card is removed from a Pokémon for any reason, put this card in its owner's discard pile.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Jamming Net Team Flare Hyper Gear
cards.text: Attach this Pokemon Tool to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon-EX that doesn't already have a Pokemon Tool attached to it.,The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 20 less damage to all Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.),When this card is removed from a Pokémon for any reason, put this card in its owner's discard pile.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Lysandre's Trump Card
cards.text: Each player shuffles all cards in his or her discard pile into his or her deck (except for Lysandre's Trump Card).,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Manectric Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Manectric-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Professor Sycamore
cards.text: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Robo Substitute Team Flare Gear
cards.text: Play this card as if it were a 30 HP Colorless Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may discard this card from play.,This card can't retreat. If this card is Knocked Out, your opponent can't take any Prize Cards for it.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Roller Skates
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw 3 cards.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Shauna
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 5 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Steel Shelter
cards.text: Each Metal Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) can't be affected by any Special Conditions. (Remove any Special Conditions affecting those Pokémon.),This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Target Whistle Team Flare Gear
cards.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from your opponent's discard pile onto his or her Bench.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Tierno
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Trick Coin
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Once during your turn, after you flip any coins for an attack of the Pokémon this card is attached to, you may ignore all effects of those coin flips and begin flipping those coins again. (You may only use effects that let you flip coins again, including effects from other cards, once during your turn.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: VS Seeker
cards.text: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Xerosic
cards.text: Choose a Pokémon Tool or Special Energy card attached to a Pokémon in play (yours or your opponent's) and discard it.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Double Colorless Energy
cards.text: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

cards.name: Mystery Energy
cards.text: This card can only be attached to Psychic Pokémon. This card provides Psychic Energy only while this card is attached to a Psychic Pokémon.,The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is ColorlessColorless less.,(If this card is attached to anything other than a Psychic Pokémon, discard this card.)

cards.name: Manectric-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Assault Laser
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Gengar-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Night Attack
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Corridor
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Malamar-EX

abilities.name: Hyper Hypnosis
abilities.text: When you attach an Energy from your hand to this Pokémon, you may use this Ability. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: MAXamar
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Florges-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Bright Garden
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Grass Pokémon and Fairy Pokémon you have in play.

cards.name: AZ
cards.text: Put 1 Pokémon into your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that Pokémon.),You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Lysandre's Trump Card
cards.text: Each player shuffles all cards in his or her discard pile into his or her deck (except for Lysandre's Trump Card).,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Xerosic
cards.text: Choose a Pokémon Tool or Special Energy card attached to a Pokémon in play (yours or your opponent's) and discard it.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: M Manectric-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Turbo Bolt
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: M Gengar-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Phantom Gate
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

cards.name: Dialga-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Chrono Wind
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Full Metal Impact
attacks.text: Discard 2 Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.
